subskills.DESCRIPTION: Compare the weight of different objects using a simple balance scale to understand that objects have different masses
Demonstrate that objects maintain their properties even when broken into smaller pieces (e.g., paper, clay, crayon)
Identify which materials sink or float in water through hands-on experimentation
Match objects to their material type (wood, metal, plastic, fabric) using touch and sight
Predict and test which materials are magnetic and non-magnetic
Observe and describe how materials respond to heat (e.g., chocolate melting, toast browning)
Sort materials based on whether they are natural or human-made
Identify which materials are transparent, translucent, or opaque using a light source
Compare the absorbency of different materials using water drops
Demonstrate how some materials can stretch or bend without breaking
Classify materials based on whether they are rough or smooth through touch exploration
Test which materials make sound when struck and describe the differences in sounds
